title.rendered: A Step-By-Step Guide to Targeted Express Entry for Engineers

[vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”15%” bottom_padding_phone=”15%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-5-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”7/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”]

[vc_column_text]“Can I immigrate to Canada as an Engineer with Targeted Express Entry?”

Yes, it is possible to immigrate to Canada as an Engineer through the Targeted Express Entry program in 2023. Are you an engineer dreaming of a new chapter in Canada? Wondering if you can immigrate to the Great White North through the esteemed Targeted Express Entry program? Look no further for answers!

As an engineer, you play a crucial role in driving innovation and technological advancements in various industries. The Canadian government recognizes the importance of engineers and has included specific occupations in the Targeted Occupations List for this category.

The Targeted Express Entry Draws for Engineers will help eligible candidates obtain Canada PR Visa at a lower CRS score. In this comprehensive guide, we provide valuable information and insights for engineers interested in pursuing immigration opportunities in Canada through Targeted Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

What is Targeted Express Entry Category-Based Selection?

The Express Entry system helps the Canadian government to manage applications for permanent residency. It aims to attract skilled workers who can contribute to the country’s economic growth. As an engineer, you have the opportunity to obtain permanent residency in Canada through Express Entry and enjoy numerous benefits.

The Canadian government conducts category-based rounds of invitations, assessing candidates against specific criteria set by the Minister to fulfill economic goals. These criteria include language proficiency, relevant work experience in specific National Occupational Classification (NOC) codes, and other general Express Entry requirements.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry for Engineers

Engineers in certain job roles are included in the Targeted Express Entry Draws conducted by Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC). It is important to note that meeting the eligibility criteria for Targeted Express Entry also requires eligibility for one of the three economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

Which Engineers are Eligible for Targeted Express Entry Draw?

Please note that while there are various occupations within the engineering field, the Targeted Express Entry List specifically focuses on the following occupations for engineers. Candidates applying under this category must have accumulated at least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in a single occupation listed below.

Occupation NOC Code Work Experience Requirement
Electrical and electronics engineers 21310 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Engineering managers 20010 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Industrial and manufacturing engineers 21321 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Metallurgical and materials engineers 21322 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Software engineers and designers 21231 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Civil engineers 21300 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years
Computer engineers (except software engineers and designers) 21311 At least 6 months of continuous work experience in the same occupation within the past 3 years

To accurately determine your NOC code and ensure you have selected the correct occupation category, it is highly recommended to seek the assistance of professional immigration experts. Alternatively, you can directly check the official website of the Canadian government for the National Occupational Classification (NOC) codes.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14118″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Prepare for Targeted Express Entry with ELAAR!

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Let’s Talk” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

How to Apply for Targeted Express Entry as an Engineer?

To apply for the Targeted Express Entry as an Engineer, follow these steps:

Determine your Eligibility: You need to fulfill the basic eligibility criteria for the targeted occupation category. This includes having at least 6 months of continuous work experience in a single occupation listed above and meeting other eligibility requirements from one of the three federal immigration programs.

Language Proficiency:  Take language proficiency tests to demonstrate your proficiency in English or French. The accepted language tests for Express Entry include the CELPIP or IELTS General test for English and TEF for French. Ensure that you achieve the minimum required score.

Create an Express Entry Profile: Create an Express Entry profile on the official Government of Canada website and provide accurate information about your work experience, education, language proficiency, and other relevant details. Based on the information provided, you will receive a Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) score.

Improve Your CRS Score: Increase your CRS score by maximizing points in areas such as language proficiency, education, work experience, and adaptability factors. Additional points can be gained by obtaining a provincial nomination through the Provincial Nominee Program (PNP).

Targeted Express Entry Draw: Candidates with higher CRS scores are more likely to receive an Invitation to Apply (ITA) during the Targeted Express Entry Draws. If you receive an ITA, you can proceed with submitting your application for permanent residency within the specified timeframe.

Submitting an Application: You have a specific timeframe to gather and submit all the required documents for your complete application. Make sure to compile everything accurately and submit it within the given timeframe.

Medical Examinations and Security Checks: As part of the application process, you may need to undergo a medical examination to ensure you meet the health requirements for immigration. Additionally, security checks will be conducted to ensure a safe and secure immigration process.

Application Processing: Once your application is submitted, it will be processed by the competent immigration authorities. Keep in mind that processing times may vary, but you can track the status of your application online.

To ensure a seamless and successful application process as an IT professional under the Targeted Express Entry program, it’s highly recommended to seek professional assistance from an experienced immigration consultant.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14117″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

How Does Colossus Migration Help Engineers?

Colossus Migration specializes in providing comprehensive support and guidance to engineers navigating the Targeted Express Entry process. Our experienced team understands the unique needs and requirements of engineers in the Canadian job market. We are dedicated to maximizing your chances of receiving an ITA as an engineer.

By assessing your eligibility, analyzing your Express Entry profile, and identifying areas for improvement, we aim to enhance your CRS score. Our consultants will guide you through optimizing your work experience, educational background, and other factors to align your profile with the specific requirements of the Targeted Express Entry Draws for engineers.

For a limited time, eligible engineers can sign up with us for as low as CAD $999 to benefit from our comprehensive services, including:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Contact us today to benefit from our expertise and personalized assistance. Together, we can navigate the complex application process and increase your chances of a successful outcome.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-4-percent” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”4/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_raw_html]JTNDZGl2JTIwY2xhc3MlM0QlMjJtbC1mb3JtLWVtYmVkJTIyJTBBJTIwJTIwZGF0YS1hY2NvdW50JTNEJTIyMzgxOTE0NiUzQWIyYzNtMHIxYzklMjIlMEElMjAlMjBkYXRhLWZvcm0lM0QlMjI1NDY1NDI2JTNBdTJ4Mms4JTIyJTNFJTBBJTNDJTJGZGl2JTNF[/vc_raw_html][vc_custom_heading text=”Trending Stories” font_container=”tag:h3|font_size:26|text_align:left|color:%230a0a0a” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1644853159092{margin-top: 40px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][recent_posts style=”list_featured_first_row” columns=”1″ category=”all” order=”DESC” orderby=”date” image_loading=”default” blog_remove_post_date=”true” blog_remove_post_author=”true” blog_remove_post_comment_number=”true” blog_remove_post_nectar_love=”true” posts_per_page=”5″ post_offset=”1″][/vc_column][/vc_row]

excerpt.rendered: Are you an Engineer looking to immigrate to Canada through Targeted Express Entry? Here is a comprehensive guide on on Targeted Express Entry, eligibility criteria, and application process.
